summary: An FBI internal email from April 3, 2020, providing an update on surveillance and investigative actions regarding Ghislaine Maxwell. It references a subpoena for phone tolls, activation of a Pen Register/Trap and Trace (PRTT) device on October 29, 2019, and a location hit in Pawtucket, Rhode Island on that date.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the FBI email, regarding whom a subpoena for phone tolls was issued and a PRTT device was activated. The email tracks location data related to her phone.

persons.name: Heyait
persons.context: The author of a previous email (dated October 30, 2019) that is being forwarded or referenced in this communication, providing an update on investigative steps.

connections.description: Heyait, an FBI correspondent, is providing an investigative update regarding surveillance and legal actions taken concerning Maxwell.

events.title: PRTT Activation and Location Hit
events.description: A Pen Register/Trap and Trace (PRTT) device was activated for Maxwell's phone, and the associated IP address showed activity in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.

events.title: Subpoena Issued for Phone Tolls
events.description: A subpoena was issued to obtain toll records (call detail records) for Maxwell's phone.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively conducting electronic surveillance on Ghislaine Maxwell as of late October 2019, using a PRTT device.
Maxwell's phone was associated with an IP address that placed her in Pawtucket, Rhode Island on October 29, 2019.
A subpoena had been issued to obtain her phone toll records, indicating a formal legal process was underway.
The document is an internal FBI email update from April 2020, showing the investigation was ongoing at that time.
